sen.j: 堀川通（ほりかわどおり）は京都市の主要な南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Horikawa-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets in Kyoto City.
Horikawa-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.
Horikawa-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の堀川小路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Horikawa-koji of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Horikawa-koji of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Horikawa-koji Street of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 一部区間には堀川 (京都府)を挟んで、東堀川通と西堀川通があるが、通常は西堀川通を堀川通と呼ぶ。
sen.e: There are Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street and the Nishi-horikawa-dori Street in some sections, which run both sides of Horkkwa (Kyoto Prefecture), but Nishi-horikawa-dori Street is usually called Horikawa-dori Street.

There are Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street and Nishi-horikawa-dori Street in some sections, which run both sides of Horikawa (Kyoto Prefecture), but Nishi-horikawa-dori Street is usually called Horikawa-dori Street.

There are Higashi-horikawa-dori Street and Nishi-horikawa-dori Street in some sections, which run along the two sides of the Hori-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), but Nishi-horikawa-dori Street is usually called Horikawa-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 堀川は河川のようですので、Hori-kawa Riverとしました。

sen.j: 現状
sen.e: Today
Today
Today

sen.j: 北は鴨川 (淀川水系)堤の加茂街道から南は東海道本線交差部北で一筋東を走っていた油小路通に合流する。
sen.e: It starts, in the north, from the Kamo-kaido Road, the bank of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system), and in the south merges with the Abura-no-koji dori Street around the north of the intersection with the Tokaido Main Line.

It starts, in the north, from Kamo-kaido Road, the bank of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system), and in the south merges with Abura-no-koji dori Street around the north of the intersection with the Tokaido Main Line.

It starts in the north, from Kamo-kaido Road to the bank of the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system), and in the south merges with Abura-no-koji dori Street, which runs one block east around the north of the intersection with the Tokaido Main Line.
sen.cmt: Yodo-gawa River systemとしました。 一筋東を追加しました。

sen.j: 幹線道路としては一続きながら、南は油小路通と別の名前をつける。
sen.e: As a highway, it stretches south but is given a different name of Abura-no-koji Street.
As a highway, it stretches south but is given the different name of Abura-no-koji Street.
As a highway it is one street, but in the south it is called Abura-no-koji Street.
sen.cmt: 原文どおりに修正しました。

sen.j: 堀川紫明通以北は4車線の幹線道路、堀川紫明から堀川今出川通までは中央分離帯の幅も広いゆったりとした6車線の幹線道路。
sen.e: The section north of the Horikawa-Shimei-dori Street is a 4-lane highway, and the section between the Horikawa-Shimei-dori Street and the Horikawa-Imadegawa-dori Street is a wide 6-lane highway.
The section north of Horikawa-Shimei-dori Street is a four-lane highway, and the section between Horikawa-Shimei-dori Street and Horikawa-Imadegawa-dori Street is a wide six-lane highway.

The section north of Horikawa-Shimei-dori Street is a four-lane highway, and the section between Horikawa-Shimei-dori Street and Horikawa-Imadegawa-dori Street is a wide, six-lane highway with a broad center divider.
sen.cmt: 中央分離帯を追加しました。

sen.j: 堀川今出川から堀川御池通は後述の通り堀川が明り区間で、東西堀川通が並び残っている。
sen.e: The section from the Horikawa-Imadegawa to the Horikawa-Oike-dori Street is tracklaying zone outside a tunnel as is described below with the both the Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street and Nishi-Horikawa-dori Street remaining parallel.

The section from the Horikawa-Imadegawa to Horikawa-Oike-dori Street is track-laying zone outside a tunnel as is described below with the both Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street and Nishi-Horikawa-dori Street remaining parallel.

In the section between Horikawa-Imadegawa and Horikawa-Oike-dori Street, Hori-kawa River is open (not a closed circuit) as described below, and both Higashi-horikawa-dori Street and Nishi-horikawa-dori Street run in parallel.
sen.cmt: 部分的に修正しました。

sen.j: 御池から暗渠になった堀川の上も道路となり、堀川五条でやや東に振れて醒ヶ井通を合わせ、西本願寺北で鍵の手に東に折れ、堀川七条通で暗渠のまま堀川は西に逸れ、堀川通は東海道本線北で一筋東の通りである油小路通に合流する。
sen.e: The street runs from Oike over the closed Horikawa, deviates east from Horikawa-Gojo, joins the Samegai-dori Street, bends east at a right angle toward east at the north of Nishi Honganji Temple, deviates west following the closed circuit, and merges, at the north side of the Tokaido Main Line, with the Abura-no-koji dori Street - a street running one block east.

The street runs from Oike over the closed Horikawa, deviates east from Horikawa-Gojo, joins Samegai-dori Street, bends east at a right angle toward east at the north of Nishi Honganji Temple, deviates west following the closed circuit and merges, at the north side of the Tokaido Main Line, with Abura-no-koji dori Street (a street running one block east).

Horikawa-dori Street runs from Oike over the closed Hori-kawa River, deviates east from Horikawa Gojo, joins Samegai-dori Street, and turns eastward at a right angle at the north of Nishi Hongan-ji Temple; while the Hori-kawa River (which is still closed) deviates west around Horikawa-shijo-dori Street, Horikawa-dori Street merges, at the north side of the Tokaido Main Line, with Abura-no-koji dori Street (a street running one block to the east).
sen.cmt: Hori-kawa River としました。 原文どおりに修正しました。

sen.j: 合流点以南の通りの名称は「油小路通」であるが、堀川通とひと続きの道路との認識から「新堀川通」と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: The name of the street south from the merging point is Abura-no-koji dori Street, but some call it Shin-horikawa-dori Street because it continues from the Horikawa-dori Street.
The name of the street south from the merging point is Abura-no-koji dori Street, but some call it Shin-horikawa-dori Street because it continues from Horikawa-dori Street.

The name of the street south of the merging point is Abura-no-koji dori Street, but some call it Shin-horikawa-dori Street (the new Horikawa-dori Street) because it continues from Horikawa-dori Street.
sen.cmt: (new Horikawa-dori Street) と補足しました。

sen.j: 七条以南では交通量の少ない西堀川通が堀川通と一区画離れて、暗渠となった堀川の上を通っている。
sen.e: South of Shichijo, there is Nishi-horikawa-dori Street running over the closed circuit, a bloc away from the Horikawa-dori Street.
South of Shichijo there is Nishi-horikawa-dori Street running over the closed circuit, a block away from Horikawa-dori Street.
South of Shichijo, Nishi-horikawa-dori Street runs a block away from Horikawa-dori Street over the closed Hori-kawa River.

sen.j: 堀川五条以南は国道1号である。
sen.e: The section south from Horikawa Gojo is National Highway Route No. 1.
The section south from Horikawa Gojo is National Highway Route No. 1.
The section south from Horikawa Gojo is National Route 1.

sen.j: 交差する道路などの特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.

sen.j: 上京区堀川通寺ノ内上ル寺ノ内堅町：34,357
sen.e: Teranouchitate-cho, Horikawa-dori Teranouchi Agaru (to the north of Horikawa-dori Teranouchi), Kamigyo Ward: 34,357

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 昔は東堀川通、川の堀川 (京都府)、西堀川通は同程度の幅であった。
sen.e: Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street, the Hori-kawa River, and the Nishi-horikawa-dori Street once had almost the same width.
Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street, the Hori-kawa River and Nishi-horikawa-dori Street were once nearly of identical width.
Higashi-horikawa-dori Street, the Hori-kawa River and Nishi-horikawa-dori Street were once of nearly identical width.

sen.j: 西堀川通は第二次世界大戦時に防火帯として沿道の家屋が強制疎開させられたため、現在ある広い通りになった。
sen.e: The Nishi-horikawa-dori Street is now wider because, during World War II, houses along it were forced to move to provide a fire blocking zone.
Nishi-horikawa-dori Street is now wider because, during World War II, the houses along it were forced to move in order to provide a fire-blocking zone.
Nishi-horikawa-dori Street is now wider because, during World War II, the houses along it were forced to move in order to provide a fire-blocking zone.

sen.j: 京都電気鉄道が開通させた後の京都市電堀川線（通称北野線、N電）は、1961年（昭和36年）に廃止になるまで狭い東堀川通を堀川中立売通から四条堀川まで走っていた。
sen.e: Horikawa Line of Kyoto Municipal Steetcar, former enu-den (narrow gauged) opened by Kyoto Electric Railway, ran on the narrow Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street from Horikawa-Nakadachiuri-dori Street to Shijo-Horikawa until it was abolished in 1961.

The Horikawa Line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar, former enu-den (narrow gauged) opened by Kyoto Electric Railway, ran on the narrow Higashi-Horikawa-dori Street from Horikawa-Nakadachiuri-dori Street to Shijo-Horikawa until 1961, when it was abolished.

The Horikawa Line of Kyoto City Trams (unofficially called the Kitano Line, N-den), which was opened by Kyoto Electric Railway, ran on the narrow Higashi-horikawa-dori Street from Horikawa-Nakadachiuri-dori Street to Shijo-Horikawa until 1961, when it was abolished.

sen.j: 堀川
sen.e: Horikawa
Horikawa
The Hori-kawa River

sen.j: 川としての堀川 (京都府)は今出川通から御池通までの区間は地上に出ているが大部分は暗渠である。
sen.e: The Horikawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) is open only in the section between the Imadegawa-dori Street and the Oike-dori with the most being the closed circuit.
The Horikawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) is open only in the section between Imadegawa-dori Street and the Oike-dori, with the majority being a closed circuit.
The Hori-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) is open only in the section between Imadegawa-dori Street and the Oike-dori Street, with the majority being a closed circuit.

sen.j: 現在は流量が少ないが、かつては西陣織の染色に利用されていた。
sen.e: The water flowing in the river is now small but was once used for dying nishijin-brocade.
